sentence.Network_cn: 我想是不关我什么事儿，你就自寻死路吧。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to warn someone that an unwise act or decision is their responsibility
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［用于提醒某人须对本人的不智行动或决定自负责任］后果由…自负

lj.lj_ly: ‘I won't discuss it.’ ‘Don't then—&B{it's your funeral}.’.
lj.lj_ls: “我不想谈这事。”“那就别谈——后果你自己负责。”。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French funeraille, from medieval Latin funeralia, neuter plural of late Latin funeralis, from Latin funus, funer- 'funeral, death, corpse'

entry.def: A funeral is the ceremony that is held when the body of someone who has died is buried or cremated.

example.ex: His funeral will be on Thursday at Blackburn Cathedral...
example.tran: 他的葬礼将于星期四在布莱克本大教堂举行。

example.ex: He was given a state funeral.

entry.tran: 这是你自作自受;那你可要倒霉了
entry.def: If someone says to you 'It's your funeral', they think your decision or your actions will have bad consequences for you, but they are unwilling to interfere.

example.ex: None of my business, I guess. It's your funeral.
example.tran: 我想是不关我什么事儿，你就自寻死路吧。

means.word_mean: 1. a ceremony at which a dead person is buried or cremated;
